required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of RGH-188 (Cariprazine) in Bipolar Depression
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of RGH-188 (Cariprazine) in Bipolar Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of cariprazine in the treatment of outpatients with bipolar depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)
primary_outcome.description: The patient is rated on a scale from 0-6 on 10 items. Apparent sadness, reported sadness, lassitude, pessimistic thoughts, inner tension, suicidal thoughts, reduced sleep and appetite, concentration difficulties, inability to feel. The overall MADRS score ranges from 0-60, with 0 meaning no symptoms and score of 60 meaning maximum severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Baseline in Clinical Global Impressions-Improvement ( CGI-I )
secondary_outcome.description: The patient was rated on a scale from 1 to 7, with 1 indicating the patient was very much improved and 7 indicating that the patient was very much worse.

arm_group.description: 0.25 - 0.75 mg/day cariprazine capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.
1.5 - 3.0 mg/day cariprazine capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.
Matching placebo capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

intervention.description: placebo capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women, 18-65 years old
- Currently meet the DSM-IV-TR criteria for Bipolar I or II Disorder without psychotic features, with a current depressive episode
- A verified previous manic, hypomanic, or mixed episode
- Score of 20 or higher on the HAMD-17
- Score of 2 or higher on Item 1 of the HAMD
Exclusion Criteria:
- Score greater than 12 on the Young Mania Rating Scale
- Eight or more episodes of a mood disturbance (depression, mania, hypomania, or mixed state) within the 12 months prior to Visit 1
- Principal DSM-IV-TR-based diagnosis of an axis I disorder other than bipolar disorder (a secondary diagnosis of comorbid Generalized Anxiety Disorder, Social Anxiety Disorder, or specific phobias is acceptable)

overall_official.affiliation: Forest Research Institute, a subsidiary of Forest Laboratories, Inc.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 233 patients were randomized to receive double-blind treatment, 227 patients received at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment and were included in safety Population

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo capsules, orally administered for 8 weeks

group.title: 0.25 to 0.75 mg Cariprazine
group.description: Cariprazine capsules 0.25 to 0.75 mg was orally administrated once daily for 8 weeks

group.title: 1.5 to 3.0 mg Cariprazine
group.description: 1.5 to 3.0 mg Cariprazine capsules, orally administrated once daily for 8 weeks

group.description: Matching placebo capsules, orally administered for 8 weeks

group.description: Cariprazine capsules 1.5 to 3.0 mg was orally administrated once daily for 8 weeks

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)
outcome.description: The patient is rated on a scale from 0-6 on 10 items. Apparent sadness, reported sadness, lassitude, pessimistic thoughts, inner tension, suicidal thoughts, reduced sleep and appetite, concentration difficulties, inability to feel. The overall MADRS score ranges from 0-60, with 0 meaning no symptoms and score of 60 meaning maximum severity.
outcome.population: of the 227 included to the safety population, the mixed-effects model for repeated measures (MMRM) of the Intent to Treat study population was 60 for placebo, 64 for 0.25-0.75 mg Cariprazine and 54 for 1.5 to 3.0 mg Cariprazine

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All data generated in this study will be the property of Forest Research Institute, Inc. An integrated clinical and statistical report will be prepared at the completion of the study. Publication of the results by the Investigator will be subject to mutual agreement between the Investigator and Forest Research Institute, Inc.
